author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Returns the results of a previous Splunk search. You can use this command in conjunction with the splunk-job-create command.
commands.name: splunk-results

commands.description: Searches Splunk for events.
commands.name: splunk-search

commands.description: Creates a new event in Splunk.
commands.name: splunk-submit-event

commands.description: Prints all Splunk index names.
commands.name: splunk-get-indexes

commands.description: Updates existing notable events in Splunk ES.
commands.name: splunk-notable-event-edit

commands.description: Creates a new search job in Splunk.
commands.name: splunk-job-create

commands.description: Parses the raw part of the event.
commands.name: splunk-parse-raw

commands.description: Sends events to an HTTP Event Collector using the Splunk platform JSON event protocol.
commands.name: splunk-submit-event-hec

commands.description: Returns the status of a job.
commands.name: splunk-job-status

commands.description: Creates a new KV store table.
commands.name: splunk-kv-store-collection-create

commands.description: Configures the KV store fields.
commands.name: splunk-kv-store-collection-config

commands.description: Adds objects to a KV store utilizing the batch-save API.
commands.name: splunk-kv-store-collection-add-entries

commands.description: Lists all collections for the specified application.
commands.name: splunk-kv-store-collections-list

commands.description: Lists all data within a specific KV store collection or collections.
commands.name: splunk-kv-store-collection-data-list

commands.description: Deletes all data within the specified KV store collection or collections.
commands.name: splunk-kv-store-collection-data-delete

commands.description: Deletes the specified KV stores.
commands.name: splunk-kv-store-collection-delete

commands.description: Searches for specific objects in a store. The search can be a basic key-value pair or a full query.
commands.name: splunk-kv-store-collection-search-entry

commands.description: Deletes the specified object in store. The search can be a basic key-value pair or a full query.
commands.name: splunk-kv-store-collection-delete-entry

commands.description: Query Splunk to retrieve a list of sample alerts by alert type. Used for mapping fetched incidents through the Get Schema option.
commands.name: get-mapping-fields

commands.description: Gets data from a notable event. This method does not update the current incident, and should be used for debugging purposes.
commands.name: get-remote-data

commands.description: Gets the list of notable events that were modified since the last update. This command should be used for debugging purposes, and is available from Cortex XSOAR version 6.1.
commands.name: get-modified-remote-data

commands.description: Resets the enrichment mechanism of fetched notables.
commands.name: splunk-reset-enriching-fetch-mechanism

description: Run queries on Splunk servers - pre release version.
name: Splunk Prerelease
readme:
When a query or alert triggers a notable event (incident) in Splunk, the notable is stored in an index (table). An XSOAR analyst can fetch the notable event and its context data all from within the XSOAR console. 

## What does this pack do?

This pack is a pre-release version of the SplunkPy pack.
It is meant to release updates for customers to test, before those updates become a part of the official integration.
Currently (July 2021), please only use this integration to fetch incidents.

Using the SplunkPy integration, you can fetch the Splunk notable events. The notable events contain details such as:
- The name of the alert that was triggered.
- The objects that make up the alert, such as the IP address, hashes, user names, etc.

Besides fetching notable events, the SplunkPy integration enables you to run drill down searches to retrieve additional data from other tables in Splunk such as:
- Data about the users (department, role, geographical location)
- Data about the assets (hostname, IP address, geographical location, department, etc.)

In addition, the integration enables mirroring from Splunk to XSOAR, from XSOAR to Splunk, and from/to XSOAR and Splunk.
